refnamediv.refpurpose: Copy a row from an f-table to another, interpolatin between rows

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: This opcode assumes the use of a table, which is a simple 1D array, to hold a 2D matrix with a given row length. Assuming such a 2D table containing multiple rows of sampled streams (for instance, the amplitudes of a set of oscilators, sampled at a regular interval), this opcode can extract one row (or a slice of a row) of that data with linear interpolation between adjacent rows (if row is not a whole number) and place the result in another table

refsect1.title: Syntax
refsect1.synopsis: tabrowlin krow, ifnsrc, ifndest, inumcols, ioffset=0, istart=0, iend=0, istep=1

refsect1.title: Initialization
refsect1.para: ifnsrc: The table index to copy data from
ifndest: The table index to copy data to (should be able to hold one row of data)
inumcols: the number of columns a row has, in the source table
ioffset: an offset to where the 2D data starts (used to skip a header, if present)
istart: start index to read from (refers to the row)
iend: end index to read from the row (not inclusive, should not exceed inumcols)
istep: step used to read along the row

refsect1.title: Performance
refsect1.para: krow -- the row o read. It can be a fractional number, in which case the row will be linearly interpolated with the next row
